com.sap.spc.document

Interface ISPCItem

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IItem, IItemBase, java.io.Serializable

    public interface ISPCItem
extends IItem
    Defines the interface to a SPCItem. It represents an extension of IItem, the SPE specific view to an item. It implements the communication needs of SCE, defined by SCEItem. From SPE, we have definitions of what Documents, Items, and Products must supply (i.e. the interfaces IDocument, IItem, and IPricingProduct). Thus, our SPC objects corresponding to these items should simply implement these interfaces, and add any needed extra (SPC-Specific) calls.

      • updateSubItemsFromConfig

        void updateSubItemsFromConfig()
                       throws ConversionMissingDataException,
                              ConversionInconsistentDataException
        Generates sub items according to the item's Config. If the item's product was changed due to the configuration the item is initialized again.
        Throws:
        ConversionMissingDataException
        ConversionInconsistentDataException

      • pricingConfiguration

        void pricingConfiguration()
                   throws ConversionMissingDataException,
                          CurrencyConversionException
        Creates subitems according to the item's current Config and performs pricing for this items and all its subitems.
        Throws:
        ConversionMissingDataException
        CurrencyConversionException

      • setConfig

        boolean setConfig(Config c)
        Changes the configuration this item holds. If the configuration doesn't fit to the product of this item or if it is null, the method will perform no operation and return false, otherwise it will return true.

        Changing a configuration will automatically adjust the subitems of this item according to the new configuration. Essentially, all old subitems are deleted and replaced by new ones that reflect the new configuration.

      • addConfig

        boolean addConfig(ext_configuration extConfig,
                  java.lang.String kbName,
                  java.lang.String kbVersion,
                  java.lang.String kbProfile,
                  SAPDate kbDate,
                  java.lang.String kbId,
                  java.util.Hashtable context)
        Changes the configuration this item holds. If the configuration doesn't fit to the product of this item or if it is null, the method will perform no operation and return false, otherwise it will return true.

        Changing a configuration will automatically adjust the subitems of this item according to the new configuration. Essentially, all old subitems are deleted and replaced by new ones that reflect the new configuration.

      • copyItem

        ISPCItem copyItem(ISPCDocument targetDocument,
                  boolean revertConfig)
        Copies a configurable ISPCItem or a high level (parent) item with all of its lower level items and its configuration and adds the copy to targetDocument.
        Parameters:
        targetDocument - the document to which the item copied is added
        revertConfig - revert sourceItem's Config to the empty Config after copying. (Currently, this parameter is ignored and assumed to be true.)
        Returns:
        a copy of sourceItem

      • setSubItemsAllowed

        void setSubItemsAllowed(boolean isSubItemsAllowed)
        Sets if this item supports sub items. Also update the internal item structure accordingly (delete all subitems or reconstruct subitems from configuration).

      • getSubItemsAllowed

        boolean getSubItemsAllowed()
        Returns true if this item may have subitems.

      • isConfigurationPart

        boolean isConfigurationPart()
        Returns true if this item is used as a part of a configuration. This flag only affects subitems of configurable items. Subitems are removed by the configurator only if they are not fitting with the configuration state and if they are configuration relevant.

      • isRealProductVariant

        boolean isRealProductVariant()
        returns true if an item is a real product variant. A real product variant is a product variant that is no individual object.

      • setConfigurationPart

        void setConfigurationPart(boolean isPart)
        Changes this item's being part of a configuration. Changing this flag will affect if this item survives configuration -< item structure updates.

      • setInitialConfiguration

        void setInitialConfiguration(ext_configuration cfg)
        Set the reference (initial) configuration for this item.

      • getInitialConfiguration

        ext_configuration getInitialConfiguration()
        Return the reference (initial) configuration for this item (CRM 5.1). Is used e.g. for comparison with the current configuration state.

      • isNotDeletable

        boolean isNotDeletable()
        Returns true if it is not allowed to delete this item. This flag only affects subitems of configurable items. Subitems are removed by the configurator only if they are not marked as not-deletable.

      • setNotDeletable

        void setNotDeletable(boolean notDeletable)
        Set whether an item is not-deletable.

      • setGridProdukt

        void setGridProdukt(boolean gridProduct)
        for gridproducts a special handling was invented: because gridproducts are from the configuration singlelevel we do not need updateSubItemsFromConfig at all. Moreover the gridproducts are structured as follows: root (configurable) | |----------------------............. | | prodVar1 prodVar2 ....... Allthough the root is configurable the subitems must not be controlled by configuration! Default for this setting is false.

      • setItemType

        void setItemType(java.lang.String itemType)
        The itemType of the Item as derived from the leading Sales Document. Within pricing the itemType is not processed but passed through to the callback for overwriting item attributes within the lean item processing.
        Parameters:
        itemType -
